reviewText:
Cheryll Gillespie is both a fashionista and a travel expert. I couldn't care less about shopping, but I love traveling. In this DVD, she heads to Toronto. Toronto is one of the most diverse cities in the world. It also has sleek skyscrapers, as well as the CN Tower.

After Cheryll went clothes shopping (which I fast forwarded through), she stopped by Dufflet Pastries. The cupcakes looked tasty (though it was only rated a 3.5 out of 5 on Yelp). She also visited the Steam Whistle Brewery and the Chinese Lantern Festival (Toronto has a large Chinese population).

She passed by the posh neighborhood of Yorkville, which reminded me of New York's Upper East Side. She also stopped by Yonge-Dundas Square, which is like Times Square and London's Piccadilly Circus. She later visited the Eaton Center Mall, which is the third largest mall in Canada (Yelp: 3.5).

Her last stop was the Hockey Hall of Fame. Canadians are crazy about hockey, but I don't know anything about it. She mentioned Wayne Gretzky, Bobby Orr, and Gordie Howe. I know who Wayne Gretzky is, only because he's hockey's version of Michael Jordan and because he played for my hometown team (NY Rangers). I never heard of the other two guys. My favorite sports are baseball, basketball, and football. They had a display of the Stanley Cup and some interactive exhibits.

Toronto isn't London, Paris, or Tokyo, but it's an interesting city.
